CHIEF COMPLAINT:
Chest pain

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:
65 year old male with history of hypertension presents with chest pain starting this morning. Pain is substernal, pressure-like, radiating to left arm.

PAST MEDICAL HISTORY:
Hypertension
Hyperlipidemia

MEDICATIONS:
Lisinopril 20mg daily
Simvastatin 40mg nightly

ALLERGIES:
NKDA

VITALS:
BP 152/88, HR 78, RR 16, Temp 98.4, SpO2 97%

PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:
Alert, in mild distress. Cardiovascular: regular rhythm, no murmurs. Lungs: clear to auscultation.

LABS:
Troponin 1.2
BNP 420

ASSESSMENT:
Acute myocardial infarction
